alert.note: Alert for Rock (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Sioux Falls (Southeastern SD, Southwestern MN, and Northwestern IA)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued February 20 at 3:01PM CST until February 23 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Sioux Falls
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions possible. Total snow accumulations of 11 to 15 inches and ice accumulations of a light glaze possible. Winds could gust as high as 55 mph. * WHERE...Portions of southwest Minnesota and east central and southeast South Dakota. * WHEN...From late Tuesday night through Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. Strong winds could cause extensive damage to trees and power lines. The cold wind chills as low as 30 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Periods of a relative lull in snowfall may occur during the daytime hours Wednesday with moderate to heavy snow rates arriving late Wednesday into early Thursday.
info.instruction: Prepare for possible blizzard conditions. Continue to monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
